name: Unnamed Project

entity_types.name: InternationalOfficial
entity_types.description: Leaders and representatives of global intergovernmental organizations like WEF, ILO, or IMF.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the official

attributes.name: org_affiliation
attributes.description: The international organization they represent

attributes.name: expertise_area
attributes.description: Primary focus area such as economy, labor, or technology

entity_types.name: CorporateExecutive
entity_types.description: High-level decision makers in companies who manage workforce strategies and business transformation.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the executive

attributes.name: company_name
attributes.description: The name of the company they lead

attributes.name: industry_sector
attributes.description: The industry cluster they operate in

entity_types.name: TechExpert
entity_types.description: Specialists in emerging technologies like AI, Big Data, and Cybersecurity who drive digital change.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the expert

attributes.name: specialization
attributes.description: Specific tech field like GenAI or Machine Learning

attributes.name: technical_background
attributes.description: Previous experience or certifications

entity_types.name: PolicyMaker
entity_types.description: Government officials responsible for labor laws, industrial policy, and economic regulation.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the official

attributes.name: government_body
attributes.description: The department or agency they work for

attributes.name: jurisdiction
attributes.description: The country or region they govern

entity_types.name: AcademicResearcher
entity_types.description: Scholars and professors focusing on the future of work, education, and skill development.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the academic

attributes.name: university_name
attributes.description: The academic institution they are affiliated with

attributes.name: field_of_study
attributes.description: Specific research focus like labor economics

entity_types.name: Journalist
entity_types.description: Media professionals who report on economic trends, job reports, and global forums.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the journalist

attributes.name: media_outlet
attributes.description: The news organization they work for

attributes.name: beat
attributes.description: The specific topic area they cover

entity_types.name: SkilledProfessional
entity_types.description: Workers in high-growth areas such as renewable energy, healthcare, and advanced manufacturing.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the professional

attributes.name: job_title
attributes.description: Specific role like Renewable Energy Engineer

attributes.name: industry_focus
attributes.description: The sector they work in, e.g., Green Transition

entity_types.name: LaborAdvocate
entity_types.description: Individuals representing workers' rights, diversity initiatives, and social equity.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the advocate

attributes.name: advocacy_group
attributes.description: The NGO or union they represent

attributes.name: focus_issue
attributes.description: Primary concern like DEI or wage equality

entity_types.name: Person
entity_types.description: Fallback type for any natural person not covered by specific categories, such as general netizens.

attributes.name: full_name
attributes.description: The full name of the person

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: Geographic location

attributes.name: bio
attributes.description: Short social media biography

entity_types.name: Organization
entity_types.description: Fallback type for any entity like small businesses, local groups, or temporary associations.

attributes.name: org_name
attributes.description: The name of the organization

attributes.name: headquarters
attributes.description: Main office location

attributes.name: mission_statement
attributes.description: The primary goal of the organization

edge_types.name: REPORTS_ON
edge_types.description: A journalist or media outlet reporting on an organization's findings or a report.

edge_types.name: EMPLOYS
edge_types.description: An organization or executive employing a professional or person.

edge_types.name: REGULATES
edge_types.description: A policy maker or government body setting rules for organizations.

edge_types.name: PROVIDES_TRAINING_TO
edge_types.description: An academic or organization offering reskilling/upskilling to individuals.

edge_types.name: ADVOCATES_FOR
edge_types.description: A labor advocate or person supporting a specific group or cause.

edge_types.name: RESPONDS_TO
edge_types.description: An entity reacting to the statements or policies of another entity.

analysis_summary: The ontology is designed to simulate social media discourse surrounding the WEF Future of Jobs Report 2025. It identifies key actors such as International Officials (WEF/ILO), Corporate Executives (employers), and Tech Experts (AI/Data specialists) who are central to the report's themes of technological disruption and workforce transformation. It also includes Policy Makers and Labor Advocates to simulate the regulatory and social equity debates mentioned in the text. Fallback types ensure all social media participants can be categorized.
simulation_requirement: analyse the future of the world
